prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Isabel dataset with streamline rendering.

Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/isabel.vti

Use the "Velocity" array as the vector field for streamlines

Generate seed points at the center of the dataset with sufficient density to cover the domain

Compute streamlines following the velocity field

Render streamlines in cyan ([0, 1, 1]) with a specified line width

Render a dataset outline in red ([1, 0, 0]) with a specified line width
generator_prompt:
You are a VTK.js visualization expert. Based on the user's requirements and the provided VTK.js examples, generate complete and functional HTML code that meets all specified requirements.
    Please follow these guidelines:
    1. Generate complete HTML code that can run independently
    2. Use the VTK.js library from CDN (https://unpkg.com/vtk.js@34.10.0/vtk.js)
    3. Implement ALL requirements specified in the user question
    4. Add detailed comments explaining how each requirement is implemented
    5. Ensure the visualization is displayed properly without UI controls unless specifically requested
    6. Use appropriate VTK.js modules and methods as shown in the examples
    7. Pay special attention to data loading paths and visualization parameters
    8. The data format for generating code is vti format, please use the correct IO module (e.g., vtkXMLImageDataReader)
    Important: Highlight in comments how each specific user requirement is addressed in the code.
evaluator_prompt:
# Role

You are an expert Evaluator for vtk.js and web-based scientific visualization. Your task is to compare the [GENERATED_CODE] against the [GROUND_TRUTH] and evaluate it based on specific dimensions.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.0</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements an entirely different visualization (streamlines) rather than the isosurface rendering of the ground truth.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.2</Score>
        <Reason>While the visualization approach is different, it still shows the dataset and velocity field, though not in the same manner as ground truth.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.8</Score>
        <Reason>The code is well-structured and follows vtk.js practices, though it implements a different functionality.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.33</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code produces a valid visualization but completely misses the target isosurface rendering.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

analysis.description: Load the Isabel dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/isabel.vti' using vtkHttpDataSetReader.
Generate seed points at the center of the dataset with sufficient density to cover the domain using vtkPlaneSource and vtkSampleFunction for uniform seeding.
Use the 'Velocity' array as the vector field to compute streamlines following the velocity field using vtkImageStreamline.
Render streamlines in cyan ([0, 1, 1]) with a specified line width using vtkGlyph3DMapper and set the actor color accordingly.
Apply vtkOutlineFilter to the dataset to generate an outline, then render it in red ([1, 0, 0]) with a specified line width using vtkMapper and vtkActor.
Initialize the render window, renderer, and interactor to display both the streamline and outline visualizations together.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageStreamline\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Visualizes a 3D vector field using `vtkImageStreamline` for streamlines, `vtkOutlineFilter` for data bounds, and seed points, with interactive resolution controls.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Rendering-GlyphMapper\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Visualizes a 3D plane with glyphs (e.g., cones) whose scale and orientation are based on scalar and vector data, using `vtkGlyph3DMapper` and `vtkCalculator`.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\IO-HttpdatasetReader\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads and visualizes a 3D model (VTP format) from a remote URL using `vtkHttpDataSetReader` with gzip support.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-Calculator\code.html
retrieval_results.description: This code visualizes a 3D plane colored by a mathematical function, using `vtkCalculator` for scalar values and `vtkMapper` for coloring.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageMarchingCubes\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Visualizes a 3D sphere by generating a scalar field with `vtkSampleFunction` and extracting an isosurface using `vtkImageMarchingCubes`.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageMarchingSquares\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Creates a 3D visualization by sampling an implicit boolean function and extracting contour lines with `vtkImageMarchingSquares`.
